greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutations with exactly 9 fixed points.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 9..200
maple: restart: G(x):=exp(-x)/(1-x)*(x^9/9!): f[0]:=G(x): for n from 1 to 26 do f[n]:=diff(f[n-1],x) od: x:=0: seq(f[n],n=9..25); # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 03 2009
mathematica: With[{nn=40}, Drop[CoefficientList[Series[Exp[-x]/(1 - x) x^9/9!, {x, 0, nn}], x]Range[0, nn]!, 9]] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 19 2014 *)
results.author: _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 25 2007
ext: Changed offset from 0 to 9 by _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 19 2014
